      60                 :            : 
      61                 :            : // Interface to light weight protocol messages.
      62                 :            : //
      63                 :            : // This interface is implemented by all protocol message objects.  Non-lite
      64                 :            : // messages additionally implement the Message interface, which is a
      65                 :            : // subclass of MessageLite.  Use MessageLite instead when you only need
      66                 :            : // the subset of features which it supports -- namely, nothing that uses
      67                 :            : // descriptors or reflection.  You can instruct the protocol compiler
      68                 :            : // to generate classes which implement only MessageLite, not the full
      69                 :            : // Message interface, by adding the following line to the .proto file:
      70                 :            : //
      71                 :            : //   option optimize_for = LITE_RUNTIME;
      72                 :            : //
      73                 :            : // This is particularly useful on resource-constrained systems where
      74                 :            : // the full protocol buffers runtime library is too big.
      75                 :            : //
      76                 :            : // Note that on non-constrained systems (e.g. servers) when you need
      77                 :            : // to link in lots of protocol definitions, a better way to reduce
      78                 :            : // total code footprint is to use optimize_for = CODE_SIZE.  This
      79                 :            : // will make the generated code smaller while still supporting all the
      80                 :            : // same features (at the expense of speed).  optimize_for = LITE_RUNTIME
      81                 :            : // is best when you only have a small number of message types linked
      82                 :            : // into your binary, in which case the size of the protocol buffers
      83                 :            : // runtime itself is the biggest problem.
      84                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT MessageLite {
      85                 :            :  public:
      86                 :     344112 :   inline MessageLite() {}
      87         [ -  + ]:     672486 :   virtual ~MessageLite() {}
      88                 :            : 
      89                 :            :   // Basic Operations ------------------------------------------------
      90                 :            : 
      91                 :            :   // Get the name of this message type, e.g. "foo.bar.BazProto".
      92                 :            :   virtual string GetTypeName() const = 0;
      93                 :            : 
      94                 :            :   // Construct a new instance of the same type.  Ownership is passed to the
      95                 :            :   // caller.
      96                 :            :   virtual MessageLite* New() const = 0;
      97                 :            : 
      98                 :            :   // Construct a new instance on the arena. Ownership is passed to the caller
      99                 :            :   // if arena is a NULL. Default implementation for backwards compatibility.
     100                 :            :   virtual MessageLite* New(::google::protobuf::Arena* arena) const;
     101                 :            : 
     102                 :            :   // Get the arena, if any, associated with this message. Virtual method
     103                 :            :   // required for generic operations but most arena-related operations should
     104                 :            :   // use the GetArenaNoVirtual() generated-code method. Default implementation
     105                 :            :   // to reduce code size by avoiding the need for per-type implementations when
     106                 :            :   // types do not implement arena support.
     107                 :       3780 :   virtual ::google::protobuf::Arena* GetArena() const { return NULL; }
     108                 :            : 
     109                 :            :   // Get a pointer that may be equal to this message's arena, or may not be. If
     110                 :            :   // the value returned by this method is equal to some arena pointer, then this
     111                 :            :   // message is on that arena; however, if this message is on some arena, this
     112                 :            :   // method may or may not return that arena's pointer. As a tradeoff, this
     113                 :            :   // method may be more efficient than GetArena(). The intent is to allow
     114                 :            :   // underlying representations that use e.g. tagged pointers to sometimes store
     115                 :            :   // the arena pointer directly, and sometimes in a more indirect way, and allow
     116                 :            :   // a fastpath comparison against the arena pointer when it's easy to obtain.
     117                 :          0 :   virtual void* GetMaybeArenaPointer() const { return GetArena(); }
     118                 :            : 
     119                 :            :   // Clear all fields of the message and set them to their default values.
     120                 :            :   // Clear() avoids freeing memory, assuming that any memory allocated
     121                 :            :   // to hold parts of the message will be needed again to hold the next
     122                 :            :   // message.  If you actually want to free the memory used by a Message,
     123                 :            :   // you must delete it.
     124                 :            :   virtual void Clear() = 0;
     125                 :            : 
     126                 :            :   // Quickly check if all required fields have values set.
     127                 :            :   virtual bool IsInitialized() const = 0;
     128                 :            : 
     129                 :            :   // This is not implemented for Lite messages -- it just returns "(cannot
     130                 :            :   // determine missing fields for lite message)".  However, it is implemented
     131                 :            :   // for full messages.  See message.h.
     132                 :            :   virtual string InitializationErrorString() const;
     133                 :            : 
     134                 :            :   // If |other| is the exact same class as this, calls MergeFrom().  Otherwise,
     135                 :            :   // results are undefined (probably crash).
     136                 :            :   virtual void CheckTypeAndMergeFrom(const MessageLite& other) = 0;
     137                 :            : 
     138                 :            :   // Parsing ---------------------------------------------------------
     139                 :            :   // Methods for parsing in protocol buffer format.  Most of these are
     140                 :            :   // just simple wrappers around MergeFromCodedStream().  Clear() will be called
     141                 :            :   // before merging the input.
     142                 :            : 
     143                 :            :   // Fill the message with a protocol buffer parsed from the given input stream.
     144                 :            :   // Returns false on a read error or if the input is in the wrong format.  A
     145                 :            :   // successful return does not indicate the entire input is consumed, ensure
     146                 :            :   // you call ConsumedEntireMessage() to check that if applicable.
     147                 :            :   bool ParseFromCodedStream(io::CodedInputStream* input);
     148                 :            :   // Like ParseFromCodedStream(), but accepts messages that are missing
     149                 :            :   // required fields.
     150                 :            :   bool ParsePartialFromCodedStream(io::CodedInputStream* input);
     151                 :            :   // Read a protocol buffer from the given zero-copy input stream.  If
     152                 :            :   // successful, the entire input will be consumed.
     153                 :            :   bool ParseFromZeroCopyStream(io::ZeroCopyInputStream* input);
     154                 :            :   // Like ParseFromZeroCopyStream(), but accepts messages that are missing
     155                 :            :   // required fields.
     156                 :            :   bool ParsePartialFromZeroCopyStream(io::ZeroCopyInputStream* input);
     157                 :            :   // Read a protocol buffer from the given zero-copy input stream, expecting
     158                 :            :   // the message to be exactly "size" bytes long.  If successful, exactly
     159                 :            :   // this many bytes will have been consumed from the input.
     160                 :            :   bool ParseFromBoundedZeroCopyStream(io::ZeroCopyInputStream* input, int size);
     161                 :            :   // Like ParseFromBoundedZeroCopyStream(), but accepts messages that are
     162                 :            :   // missing required fields.
     163                 :            :   bool ParsePartialFromBoundedZeroCopyStream(io::ZeroCopyInputStream* input,
     164                 :            :                                              int size);
     165                 :            :   // Parses a protocol buffer contained in a string. Returns true on success.
     166                 :            :   // This function takes a string in the (non-human-readable) binary wire
     167                 :            :   // format, matching the encoding output by MessageLite::SerializeToString().
     168                 :            :   // If you'd like to convert a human-readable string into a protocol buffer
     169                 :            :   // object, see google::protobuf::TextFormat::ParseFromString().
     170                 :            :   bool ParseFromString(const string& data);
     171                 :            :   // Like ParseFromString(), but accepts messages that are missing
     172                 :            :   // required fields.
     173                 :            :   bool ParsePartialFromString(const string& data);
     174                 :            :   // Parse a protocol buffer contained in an array of bytes.
     175                 :            :   bool ParseFromArray(const void* data, int size);
     176                 :            :   // Like ParseFromArray(), but accepts messages that are missing
     177                 :            :   // required fields.
     178                 :            :   bool ParsePartialFromArray(const void* data, int size);
     179                 :            : 
     180                 :            : 
     181                 :            :   // Reads a protocol buffer from the stream and merges it into this
     182                 :            :   // Message.  Singular fields read from the input overwrite what is
     183                 :            :   // already in the Message and repeated fields are appended to those
     184                 :            :   // already present.
     185                 :            :   //
     186                 :            :   // It is the responsibility of the caller to call input->LastTagWas()
     187                 :            :   // (for groups) or input->ConsumedEntireMessage() (for non-groups) after
     188                 :            :   // this returns to verify that the message's end was delimited correctly.
     189                 :            :   //
     190                 :            :   // ParsefromCodedStream() is implemented as Clear() followed by
     191                 :            :   // MergeFromCodedStream().
     192                 :            :   bool MergeFromCodedStream(io::CodedInputStream* input);
     193                 :            : 
     194                 :            :   // Like MergeFromCodedStream(), but succeeds even if required fields are
     195                 :            :   // missing in the input.
     196                 :            :   //
     197                 :            :   // MergeFromCodedStream() is just implemented as MergePartialFromCodedStream()
     198                 :            :   // followed by IsInitialized().
     199                 :            :   virtual bool MergePartialFromCodedStream(io::CodedInputStream* input) = 0;
     200                 :            : 
     201                 :            : 
     202                 :            :   // Serialization ---------------------------------------------------
     203                 :            :   // Methods for serializing in protocol buffer format.  Most of these
     204                 :            :   // are just simple wrappers around ByteSize() and SerializeWithCachedSizes().
     205                 :            : 
     206                 :            :   // Write a protocol buffer of this message to the given output.  Returns
     207                 :            :   // false on a write error.  If the message is missing required fields,
     208                 :            :   // this may GOOGLE_CHECK-fail.
     209                 :            :   bool SerializeToCodedStream(io::CodedOutputStream* output) const;
     210                 :            :   // Like SerializeToCodedStream(), but allows missing required fields.
     211                 :            :   bool SerializePartialToCodedStream(io::CodedOutputStream* output) const;
     212                 :            :   // Write the message to the given zero-copy output stream.  All required
     213                 :            :   // fields must be set.
     214                 :            :   bool SerializeToZeroCopyStream(io::ZeroCopyOutputStream* output) const;
     215                 :            :   // Like SerializeToZeroCopyStream(), but allows missing required fields.
     216                 :            :   bool SerializePartialToZeroCopyStream(io::ZeroCopyOutputStream* output) const;
     217                 :            :   // Serialize the message and store it in the given string.  All required
     218                 :            :   // fields must be set.
     219                 :            :   bool SerializeToString(string* output) const;
     220                 :            :   // Like SerializeToString(), but allows missing required fields.
     221                 :            :   bool SerializePartialToString(string* output) const;
     222                 :            :   // Serialize the message and store it in the given byte array.  All required
     223                 :            :   // fields must be set.
     224                 :            :   bool SerializeToArray(void* data, int size) const;
     225                 :            :   // Like SerializeToArray(), but allows missing required fields.
     226                 :            :   bool SerializePartialToArray(void* data, int size) const;
     227                 :            : 
     228                 :            :   // Make a string encoding the message. Is equivalent to calling
     229                 :            :   // SerializeToString() on a string and using that.  Returns the empty
     230                 :            :   // string if SerializeToString() would have returned an error.
     231                 :            :   // Note: If you intend to generate many such strings, you may
     232                 :            :   // reduce heap fragmentation by instead re-using the same string
     233                 :            :   // object with calls to SerializeToString().
     234                 :            :   string SerializeAsString() const;
     235                 :            :   // Like SerializeAsString(), but allows missing required fields.
     236                 :            :   string SerializePartialAsString() const;
     237                 :            : 
     238                 :            :   // Like SerializeToString(), but appends to the data to the string's existing
     239                 :            :   // contents.  All required fields must be set.
     240                 :            :   bool AppendToString(string* output) const;
     241                 :            :   // Like AppendToString(), but allows missing required fields.
     242                 :            :   bool AppendPartialToString(string* output) const;
     243                 :            : 
     244                 :            :   // Computes the serialized size of the message.  This recursively calls
     245                 :            :   // ByteSizeLong() on all embedded messages.
     246                 :            :   //
     247                 :            :   // ByteSizeLong() is generally linear in the number of fields defined for the
     248                 :            :   // proto.
     249                 :            :   virtual size_t ByteSizeLong() const = 0;
     250                 :            : 
     251                 :            :   // Legacy ByteSize() API.
     252                 :        160 :   int ByteSize() const { return internal::ToIntSize(ByteSizeLong()); }
     253                 :            : 
     254                 :            :   // Serializes the message without recomputing the size.  The message must not
     255                 :            :   // have changed since the last call to ByteSize(), and the value returned by
     256                 :            :   // ByteSize must be non-negative.  Otherwise the results are undefined.
     257                 :            :   virtual void SerializeWithCachedSizes(
     258                 :            :       io::CodedOutputStream* output) const = 0;
     259                 :            : 
     260                 :            :   // Functions below here are not part of the public interface.  It isn't
     261                 :            :   // enforced, but they should be treated as private, and will be private
     262                 :            :   // at some future time.  Unfortunately the implementation of the "friend"
     263                 :            :   // keyword in GCC is broken at the moment, but we expect it will be fixed.
     264                 :            : 
     265                 :            :   // Like SerializeWithCachedSizes, but writes directly to *target, returning
     266                 :            :   // a pointer to the byte immediately after the last byte written.  "target"
     267                 :            :   // must point at a byte array of at least ByteSize() bytes.  Whether to use
     268                 :            :   // deterministic serialization, e.g., maps in sorted order, is determined by
     269                 :            :   // CodedOutputStream::IsDefaultSerializationDeterministic().
     270                 :            :   virtual uint8* SerializeWithCachedSizesToArray(uint8* target) const;
     271                 :            : 
     272                 :            :   // Returns the result of the last call to ByteSize().  An embedded message's
     273                 :            :   // size is needed both to serialize it (because embedded messages are
     274                 :            :   // length-delimited) and to compute the outer message's size.  Caching
     275                 :            :   // the size avoids computing it multiple times.
     276                 :            :   //
     277                 :            :   // ByteSize() does not automatically use the cached size when available
     278                 :            :   // because this would require invalidating it every time the message was
     279                 :            :   // modified, which would be too hard and expensive.  (E.g. if a deeply-nested
     280                 :            :   // sub-message is changed, all of its parents' cached sizes would need to be
     281                 :            :   // invalidated, which is too much work for an otherwise inlined setter
     282                 :            :   // method.)
     283                 :            :   virtual int GetCachedSize() const = 0;
     284                 :            : 
     285                 :            :   virtual uint8* InternalSerializeWithCachedSizesToArray(bool deterministic,
     286                 :            :                                                          uint8* target) const;
